channel.title: SaaS we use for KickoffLabs SaaS
channel.description:
This list is way longer than I excepted it to be.
[SaaS behind our SaaS][1]
We actually cut out a couple services we do not use too often or didn't have anything interesting about them to share.
I would love to hear other services you all may be using.
[1]: http://blog.kickofflabs.com/saas-behind-our-saas/

item.title: SaaS we use for KickoffLabs SaaS
item.dc:creator: akevon
item.description:
Hi @scottw thanks for the share that was a very insightful post.

It’s actually impressive how much companies spend on SaaS nowadays without being fully aware of it. I did a similar analysis of my own spend recently (just my own individual spend) and was surprised to find I broke $3k.

This is actually one of the reasons I embarked on CloudPal, since I think there’s going to be a growing need for centralized control over all the cloud services people consume part of which includes clear oversight on spend.

Read full topic
item.source: SaaS we use for KickoffLabs SaaS

item.title: SaaS we use for KickoffLabs SaaS
item.dc:creator: Lewis
item.description:
One of them here:

How we’re spending $55,930.08 a year on SaaS products Interesting Links
http://blog.sawhorsemedia.com/post/104076088572/how-were-spending-55-930-08-a-year-on-saas "We’re sharing our spending here in hopes it’ll be useful for other startups that use and or sell online software." [...] "Below is a list of what we’re spending a month for every SaaS service based on actual October numbers. In cases where we pay annually, the monthly equivalent is shown. I’ve excluded pure hosting (Amazon, Linode, etc.), but included email service providers like MailChimp. I’ve also …
